decisions.assessment: All three assets are in a ranging regime with convergent 4h weakness despite modest 24h gains — combined with missing derivatives data (CVD, L/S), there is insufficient signal quality to justify new positions on a fresh $5K book.

decisions.reasoning: Ranging regime with mild 4h weakness (-0.12%). Positive 24h (+1.76%) is encouraging but insufficient to overcome the ranging classification. Critical: CVD_ratio and L/S_zscore are both N/A — I'm flying without two of the most important derivatives signals. Zero funding rate means no leverage overhang to trade against. Without RL posteriors or trade history, I cannot validate which signal types are reliable. BTC ~$83.5K may be mid-range; need to identify range boundaries before committing capital.

ETH is underperforming BTC on the 4h frame (-1.12% vs -0.12%), a warning sign of relative weakness. Despite positive 24h (+0.96%), the 4h divergence from BTC suggests ETH is not leading. High volume ($52K) without directional derivative data makes this ambiguous. Ranging regime + no CVD = no conviction for a long.

SOL has the strongest 24h return (+1.99%) but the worst 4h print (-1.30%) — a divergence that often signals a mean-reversion pullback within a range. Very high volume ($426K) is notable but without CVD we cannot determine if that volume is buying or selling pressure. Ranging regime is hostile to momentum entries. Watching for SOL to find support and confirm trend before entering.

decisions.memory: FIRST RUN — Ranging market. BTC $83,577 | ETH $1,887 | SOL $125. All 4h negative. CVD & L/S data N/A — major blind spot. Zero funding rates across board. Watch BTC range: support ~$83K, resistance ~$85K. No positions. Deploy only on clear breakout + volume + derivative confirmation. Portfolio: $5K cash, 0 deployed.
